text: Atta Yaqub (born 1979) is a Scottish model and actor of Pakistani/Punjabi descent. He played the lead role in the 2004 film Ae Fond Kiss.... ==Career== Yaqub began modelling as a teenager. He appeared in ads for The Royal Bank of Scotland and Cruise. He made his acting debut in Ken Loach's film Ae Fond Kiss where he played a Muslim man who falls in love with an Irish Catholic woman. For his role he was nominated for a British Independent Film Award for Best Newcomer. He featured in Running in Traffic and Nina's Heavenly Delights. In 2011 he entered international cinema with the German film Fernes Land (Junction Point) and Sabiha Sumar's Rafina. In 2012 he joined the cast of the BBC Three drama Lip Service. ==Personal life== Yaqub has a degree in IT management and also works as a counselor, advising drug addicts. He is a representative for the Goethe-Institut. He goes to schools around Scotland to promote the Show Racism The Red Card programme. He was also involved in the "One Scotland, Many Cultures" anti-racism campaign. Yaqub speaks English and Punjabi fluently as well as some Urdu and German. Yaqub was educated at Shawlands Academy, Glasgow.https://www.eyeforfilm.co.uk/feature/2004-09-18-atta-yaqub-on-ae-fond- kiss-feature-story-by-brian-pendreigh In 2009, Yaqub criticised Prince Harry for making what he saw as prejudiced comments about South Asians and asked for a personal apology. == Filmography == {| class="wikitable" style="font- size:90%;" ! style="background:#B0C4DE;" | Year ! style="background:#B0C4DE;" | Film ! style="background:#B0C4DE;" | Role ! style="background:#B0C4DE;" | Notes |- |rowspan="2"| 2004 | Ae Fond Kiss... | Casim Khan | |- |Doctors | Madhav Verma | "Party Games" |- |rowspan="4"| 2005 | The Camping Trip | Sunny | |- | Meet the Magoons | Suky Riprah | "Stairway to Havan" |- | Perfect Day | Ash | |- | Pakistani Actually | Himself | Documentary |- |rowspan="3"| 2006 | New Street Law |Nadeem Rashid | Season 1, Episode 5 |- | Explosions | Hassans | |- | Nina's Heavenly Delights | Kary Shah | |- |rowspan="1"| 2007 | Karachi Uncovered |Himself | BBC documentary |- |rowspan="1"| 2009 | Running in Traffic |Amman | |- |rowspan="1"| 2011 | Fernes Land |Haroon | German-language film |- |rowspan="1"| 2012 | Lip Service | | Season 2 |- |rowspan="1"| 2015 | Good Morning Karachi | Jamal | |} == References == == External links == * *Atta Yaqub's Modelling Page Category:1979 births Category:Living people Category:Scottish people of Pakistani descent Category:Scottish people of Punjabi descent Category:Scottish actors of South Asian descent Category:Scottish male models Category:Anti-racism activists Category:Male actors from Glasgow Category:Alumni of the University of Strathclyde Category:Scottish male film actors Category:Scottish male television actors Category:British film actors of Pakistani descent Category:British models of Pakistani descent Category:British male actors of South Asian descent
title: Atta Yaqub
